meanings.sent1: I saw many colorful crays in the aquarium.
meanings.sent2: The children collected some crays to study in science class.
meanings.sent3: The crays seemed to be having a cray party in the water.
meanings.sent4: The crays scuttled around like tiny rainbows on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful picture of the crays.

meanings.definition: Crays: third person singular present of cray
meanings.sent1: He crays when he is happy.
meanings.sent2: She always crays when she hears a good joke.
meanings.sent3: The puppy crays with joy when its owner comes home.
meanings.sent4: The singer's voice crays with emotion during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The baby crays softly in her sleep.

meanings.sent1: The fishermen caught many crays in the river.
meanings.sent2: We had a delicious meal of grilled crays at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The crays in the tank waved their claws at each other playfully.
meanings.sent4: The crays scuttled away quickly when they sensed danger.
meanings.sent5: The chef prepared a special dish using fresh crays.
